solution_line_template: If Ed has {dogs} dogs and {cats} cats he has in total {dogs}+{cats} = <<{dogs}+{cats}={non_fish_pets}>>{non_fish_pets} pets that are not fish
If Ed has twice as many cats and dogs combined he has {multiplier_for_fish}*{non_fish_pets} = <<{multiplier_for_fish}*{non_fish_pets}={fish}>>{fish} fish
Therefore, in total Ed has {non_fish_pets}+{fish} = <<{non_fish_pets}+{fish}={total_pets}>>{total_pets} pets
